section.title: Performance
section.para: Changes in SQLite are ACID (atomic, consistent, isolated, durable). This means that every update, insert and delete operation is ACID. Unfortunately this requires some overhead in the database processing therefore you should wrap updates in the SQLite database in an transaction and commit this transaction after several operations. This can significantly improve performance.
The following code demonstrates that performance optimization.

For larger data updates you should use the yieldIfContededSafely() method. SQLite locks the database during an transaction. With this call, Android checks if someone else queries the data and if finish automatically the transaction and opens a new one. This way the other process can access the data in between.
